intro: Rathkea pubescens, commonly known as the hairy rathkea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Rathkea pubescens is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
